Question: Shuffling values in HashMap: :I would like to shuffle values in an HashMap. I have following type of HashMapMap<Integer,ArrayList<String> > trainDataSet = new HashMap<Integer, ArrayList<String>>();I would like to shuffle the values in the Map. How would i do it? Following is my attempt:    collections.shuffle(trainDataSet.values());Got an error:    Values cannot be cast to java.util.ListYes this make sense, because my values are in Arraylist not in List. Would it be possible to shuffle collections of arraylist?EDITIf i have following order::key1  [aa,bb,cd]key2  [xx,xy,sfr]Into something likekey1  [xx,xy,sfr]key2  [aa,bb,cd]
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: ASSISTANT:
response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Map<Integer, ArrayList<String>> trainDataSet = new HashMap<Integer, ArrayList<String>>();
trainDataSet.put(1, new ArrayList<String>{"aa", "bb", "cd"});
trainDataSet.put(2, new ArrayList<String>{"xx", "xy", "sfr"});
Iterator<Map.Entry<Integer, ArrayList<String>>> iterator = trainDataSet.entrySet().iterator();
while (iterator.hasNext()) {
ArrayList<String> values = iterator.next().getValue();
Collections.shuffle(values);
iterator.remove();
trainDataSet.put(iterator.next().getKey(), values);
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code creates a HashMap with two key-value pairs. Then, it iterates over the entries of the HashMap using an iterator. For each entry, it gets the values, shuffles them using the Collections.shuffle() method, and then removes the entry from the HashMap. Finally, it puts the shuffled values back into the HashMap with the original key. This code will shuffle the values in the HashMap.
